text: Ursula Bailey Marvin (August 20, 1921 â€“ February 12, 2018)R.R. Bowker Co (2009). American Men & Women of Science. Thomson/Gale was an American planetary geologist and author. She worked for the Smithsonian Astrophysical Observatory.ABC-CLIO American Women of Science Since 1900 She won the 1997 Lifetime Achievement Award from Women in Science and Engineering.Staff report (July 1997). Ursula Marving honoers by 'WISE' award for lifetime achievement in science. The CfA Almanac Asteroid (4309) Marvin is named in her honour. Marvin died at a retirement home in Concord, Massachusetts on February 12, 2018 at the age of 96. ==References== Category:1921 births Category:2018 deaths Category:American astronomers Category:American geologists Category:Scientists from Vermont Category:Scientists from Massachusetts Category:People from Burlington, Vermont
title: Ursula B. Marvin
